inlineContent.text: The nRF Mesh library allows to provision Bluetooth mesh devices into a mesh network, configure
them and send and receive messages.
The library is compatible with the following
Mesh Protocol 1.1
(backwards compatible with
Mesh Profile 1.0.1
Mesh Model 1.1
Mesh Device Properties 2
Configuration Database Profile 1.0.1
Implementing ADV Bearer on iOS is not possible due to API limitations.
The library is using GATT Proxy protocol, specified in the Bluetooth Mesh Protocol 1.1,
and requires a Node with GATT Proxy feature to relay messages to the mesh network.
The
is the main entry point for interacting with the mesh network.
It can be used to create, load or import a Bluetooth mesh network configuration and send
and receive messages.
The snippet below demonstrates how to start.

code: // Create the Mesh Network Manager instance.

abstract.text: Mesh network manager is the main entry point for the mesh network. It manages the network,
allows sending and processing messages to and from bearers and initializes
provisioning procedure.
Bearers are objects responsible for delivering PDUs to remote nodes. Bluetooth mesh, among others. defines
ADV Bearer and GATT Bearer. Due to API limitations on iOS the ADV Bearer is not available. An iPhone
can be connected to the mesh network using a GATT connection to a node with GATT Proxy feature.
GATT Bearer is used when connecting to a node with GATT Proxy feature. It uses a GATT connection
instead of Bluetooth advertising. Messages sent over that bearer need to be proxied to the network
using ADV Bearer by the GATT Proxy node.
PB Remote Bearer allows to provision a device which does not support GATT Mesh Provisioning Service
via a node with Remote Provisioning Server model.
Provisioning is the process of adding an unprovisioned device to a mesh network in a secure way.
In order to reduce the number of Network PDUs exchanged between a Proxy Client and a
Proxy Server, a proxy filter can be used.
Provision, configure and control Bluetooth mesh devices with nRF Mesh library.

A Remote Provisioning PDU Report message is an unacknowledged message used by
the Remote Provisioning Server to report the Provisioning PDU that either was
received from the device being provisioned or was generated locally during the
Device Key Refresh procedure, the Node Address Refresh procedure, or the
Node Composition Refresh procedure.
A Scene represents a set of states stored with a Scene Number.

A Remote Provisioning PDU Send message is an unacknowledged message used by
the Remote Provisioning Client to deliver the Provisioning PDU to an
unprovisioned device or to the Node Provisioning Protocol Interface.

Provisioning is the process of adding an unprovisioned device to a mesh network in a secure way.

message is an acknowledged message used to get
the current SAR Receiver state of a Node.
A Remote Provisioning PDU Outbound Report message is an unacknowledged message
used by the Remote Provisioning Server to report completion of the delivery
of the Provisioning PDUs that the Remote Provisioning Server either sends to
a device that is being provisioned or processes locally during the
Device Key Refresh procedure, the Node Address Refresh procedure,
or the Node Composition Refresh procedure.
A Remote Provisioning Scan Status message is an unacknowledged message used by
the Remote Provisioning Server to report the current value of the
Remote Provisioning Scan Parameters state and the Remote Provisioning Scan state
of a Remote Provisioning Server model.
The Network Keys are used to encrypt mesh messages on the Network Layer.

feature supported and enabled.
